page.title: 11White Lady,Sherburn-in-Elmet
page.content: There was once a man and a woman and they were just going to get married. They were driving along in a carriage, something frightened the horse,perhaps a rabbit or a weasel.The horse bolted and the lady fell out of the carriage into the pond and drowned.She is called the White Lady because she was all dressed in white.It is said if you go round the pond twice and get dizzy not to go round the third time because the White Lady's hand will come out and grab you by the ankle and pull you in. {Sherburn-in-Elmet Church under attack. Many years ago there were some monks under attack at Sherburn Church.5 or 6 of them made a plan to escape.They got spades and dug each night until they got to Huddlestone Hall.When they got there they celebrated with cheese and bread,later leaving for another Church
